metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0876 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The XML parser (xmlparse.c) in expat before 2.1.0 computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via an XML file with many identifiers with the same value.

notes.Note: jdstrand> RedHat issued https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2012-1250.html for python as a result of the added XML_SetHashSalt symbol ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: cadaver package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
matanza package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6').
xotcl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
